item.title: How to Publish a Neovim Plugin
item.description: Turning snippets into plugins that everyone can use Table of Contents The Structure of a Neovim Plugin Logic Dependencies and what they can do for you Publishing and Usage Conclusion Every Neovim power-user reaches a point when their init.lua becomes a mess of old code snippets. Since I use Markdown files every day for notes, planning and general writing, my breaking point was functions for Markdown formatting. I was tired of manually aligning Markdown tables and manually creating a Table of Contents for each file, along with streamlining embedding of hyperlinks and images.

item.title: my-markdown
item.description: My relationship with markdown I use markdown every single day. It’s become an essential part of my workflow, and this started with note taking apps like Obsidian and Ulysses. When I found Neovim, everything changed. I started just making todo lists in markdown, within Neovim, and since all my notes were .md files, it was a really easy and natural way to organize my thoughts and things I had to do without switching context.
